Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: ஒட்டார்பின் சென்றொருவன் வாழ்தலின் அந்நிலையேகெட்டான் எனப்படுதல் நன்று.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: It is better for a man to be said of him that he died in his usual state than that he eked out his life by following those who disgraced him.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split composition showing two fates for an honorable person.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the left, the person is shown living a miserable, degraded life by following and serving an enemy who hates them ('ஒட்டார்பின் சென்று வாழ்தல்'). They are alive but completely stripped of dignity.
Layered_Composition.Background: On the right, the same person is shown having chosen to perish rather than submit. They are represented by a noble memorial stone or a heroic death scene ('கெட்டான்'). This fate, though it is death, is bathed in a light of honor and respect. It is clearly presented as the 'better' ('நன்று') option.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: It is better to be known as 'one who perished' with honor intact than to continue living a life of disgrace by submitting to one's enemies.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The contrast between a life of shame and a death of honor is the central theme. The memorial stone is a symbol of respected memory, while the living person on the other side has no such honor.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Honorable death vs. shameful life, noble choice, dignified.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The life of shame is depicted in dark, muddy, and degrading colors. The scene of honorable death is lit with a pure, white-gold light of glory and respect.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A balanced diptych shot that presents the two choices and their resulting states of honor.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with a strong contrast in the emotional tone of the two scenes.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Dualistic lighting to contrast glory and shame.

Cultural_Anchors: Living by following one's haters (ஒட்டார்பின் சென்று வாழ்தல்)
